column4: Ubuntu 10.04: How can I tell if I have the 32 or 64 bit version installed?
I know it's stupid, but I forgot which I installed. :P
=P
run 'arch' command?
ok thanks. :)
mscotta++, you want the cpu arch or the OS?
try 'uname -a'
I wanted both, I got both. i686 on the OS is a 32-bit install right?
or 'uname -mrsn
right but an i686 software install is 32 bit.
yeah. XD
i'm betting you have 32bit ubuntu installed
I do... I'm going to have to get 64-bit 10.04 or 10.10.
what's the point?
This is it. I want to install Ubuntu on this MacBook that I'm typing on right now, and I knew I had one Ubuntu 10.04 CD around but I didn't know if it was 32 or 64.
i get that part, just wondering why you feel the need to change to 64bit
I'm going to have to download a 64-bit version..
oh because this MacBook Pro has 4GB RAM.
LOL! What does that mean? :P
they don't spend the extra money for the Apple brand
hehe... The Mactel Team does. :D
yup. ;)
